text: Python object attributes - methodology for access
Suppose I have a class with some attributes.
How is it best (in the Pythonic-OOP) sense to access these attributes ?
What are the accepted naming styles for such things ?

Edit:
Can you elaborate on the best-practices of naming attributes with a single or double leading underscore ?
I see in most modules that a single underscore is used.
If this question has already been asked (and I have a hunch it has, though searching didn't bring results), please point to it - and I will close this one.
